User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

see reproducibility

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Under tools|options|privacy, set cookie management to 'accept cookies from sites' but also 'keep until' as 'ask me every time'
2. for a given site X of your choice (I use theregister.co.uk) that requires cookies and a password, but password before cookies, clear cookies and pswd for that site (so they will be asked for next time). 
3. go to X & try to log in. Password manager popup will appear asking if you'd like to remember password, a second later the cookie manager will show a 'what do you want to do with this cookie?' popup, which immediately removes the password manager popup, before you can click on it.

Actual Results:  
Can't save password easily. Can get around by allowing cookie to be saved first time round then logging in 2nd time but that's not the point.

Expected Results:  
Able to save pswd and cookie in one go. 

Suggestion: don't change functionality that works. Previous system used by fx 3 worked , why mess around with it?
